trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from Python | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from Python | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service from Python to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service from Python to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Queue storage service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Queue storage service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include inserting, peeking, getting, and deleting queue messages, as well as creating and deleting queues.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include inserting, peeking, getting, and deleting queue messages, as well as creating and deleting queues.

trans-unit.source: For more information on queues, refer to the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on queues, refer to the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, please see the <linkText>Python Installation Guide</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, please see the <linkText>Python Installation Guide</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The QueueService object lets you work with queues.
trans-unit.target: The QueueService object lets you work with queues.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a QueueService object.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a QueueService object.

trans-unit.source: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a QueueService object using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a QueueService object using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.

trans-unit.source: To insert a message into a queue, use the put\_message method to create a new message and add it to the queue.
trans-unit.target: To insert a message into a queue, use the put\_message method to create a new message and add it to the queue.

trans-unit.source: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it from the queue by calling the peek\_messages method.
trans-unit.target: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it from the queue by calling the peek\_messages method.

trans-unit.source: By default, peek\_messages peeks at a single message.
trans-unit.target: By default, peek\_messages peeks at a single message.

trans-unit.source: Your code removes a message from a queue in two steps.
trans-unit.target: Your code removes a message from a queue in two steps.

trans-unit.source: When you call get\_messages, you get the next message in a queue by default.
trans-unit.target: When you call get\_messages, you get the next message in a queue by default.

trans-unit.source: A message returned from get\_messages becomes invisible to any other code reading messages from this queue.
trans-unit.target: A message returned from get\_messages becomes invisible to any other code reading messages from this queue.

trans-unit.source: By default, this message stays invisible for 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: By default, this message stays invisible for 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also call delete\_message.
trans-unit.target: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also call delete\_message.

trans-unit.source: This two-step process of removing a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message and try again.
trans-unit.target: This two-step process of removing a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message and try again.

trans-unit.source: Your code calls delete\_message right after the message has been processed.
trans-unit.target: Your code calls delete\_message right after the message has been processed.

trans-unit.source: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.
trans-unit.target: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.

trans-unit.source: If the message represents a work task, you could use this feature to update the status of the work task.
trans-unit.target: If the message represents a work task, you could use this feature to update the status of the work task.

trans-unit.source: The code below uses the update\_message method to update a message.
trans-unit.target: The code below uses the update\_message method to update a message.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.

trans-unit.source: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).
trans-unit.target: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).

trans-unit.source: Second, you can set a longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less time to fully process each message.
trans-unit.target: Second, you can set a longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less time to fully process each message.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the get\_messages method to get 16 messages in one call.
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses the get\_messages method to get 16 messages in one call.

trans-unit.source: Then it processes each message using a for loop.
trans-unit.target: Then it processes each message using a for loop.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the invisibility timeout to five minutes for each message.
trans-unit.target: It also sets the invisibility timeout to five minutes for each message.

trans-unit.source: You can get an estimate of the number of messages in a queue.
trans-unit.target: You can get an estimate of the number of messages in a queue.

trans-unit.source: The get\_queue\_metadata method asks the queue service to return metadata about the queue, and the x-ms-approximate-messages-count should be used as the index into the returned dictionary to find the count.
trans-unit.target: The get\_queue\_metadata method asks the queue service to return metadata about the queue, and the x-ms-approximate-messages-count should be used as the index into the returned dictionary to find the count.

trans-unit.source: The result is only approximate because messages can be added or removed after the queue service responds to your request.
trans-unit.target: The result is only approximate because messages can be added or removed after the queue service responds to your request.

trans-unit.source: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the delete\_queue method.
trans-unit.target: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the delete\_queue method.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have learned the basics of queue storage, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have learned the basics of queue storage, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.
